SEARCH
Package gw.processes

Interface BatchProcess

All Known Implementing Classes:
BatchProcessBase, com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.MultiPhaseBatchProcess, RetryingBatchProcess, com.guidewire.pl.system.batchprocessing.SinglePhaseBatchProcess
public interface BatchProcess
Interface for a BatchProcess that can be managed by a BatchProcessManager. A BatchProcess can expect to be launched in a newly-created thread, and will generally be provided with a callback that should be called upon completion.

  • Method Details

    • checkInitialConditions

      @Deprecated default boolean checkInitialConditions()
      Deprecated.
      Use getInitialState() instead.

    • getInitialState

      default BatchProcessInitialState getInitialState()
      Checks the conditions necessary for this batch process to run, such as server runlevels. If the initial conditions are not met, this method should return BatchProcessInitialState#notReady(), in which case the batch process will not be started on the current server until this method returns BatchProcessInitialState#ready(). The batch process may be started on a different server even if this method returns notReady(). This method must be overridden.

    • isExclusive

      boolean isExclusive()
      Returns whether another batch process can be launched while this batch process is running.

    • run

      void run() throws InterruptedException
      Start the process. The process should continue to run until completion or until the stop method is called.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the process receives a terminate call.

    • requestTermination

      boolean requestTermination()
      Request that the process terminate. The process should exit after completion of its next operation and its run method must throw an InterruptedException. Note that after this method returns the process has not yet terminated. This method should be non-blocking.
      Returns:
      true if the process could be successfully terminated, false if it could not

    • getType

      BatchProcessType getType()
      Returns the type of this batch process.
      Returns:
      the type of batch process

    • getOperationsCompleted

      int getOperationsCompleted()
      Returns:
      The number of units of work completed by the batch process, including failed units.

    • getOperationsExpected

      int getOperationsExpected()
      Returns:
      The number of units of work expected to be completed by the batch process.

    • getOperationsFailed

      int getOperationsFailed()
      Returns:
      The number of units of work that failed processing.

    • getOperationsFailedReasons

      List<String> getOperationsFailedReasons()
      Returns:
      The list of failure reasons of units of work that failed processing (size of the list should match the number of getOperationsFailed().

    • getReturnValue

      String getReturnValue()
      Returns return value from the batch process, or null if batch process has not completed, or does not have a return value.
      Returns:
      a short string value set by the called batch process as a return value

    • isFinished

      boolean isFinished()
      Asks if the process has completed or not. Completion says nothing about the error state of the process.
      Returns:
      true if the process has completed or false if not

    • getProgress

      String getProgress()
      Returns:
      a string in the form "x of y" where 'x' is the amount of work completed and 'y' is the total amount of work. If 'y' is unknown, returns just "x".

    • getDescription

      String getDescription()
      This will return an optional description for this specific batch process run, it normally only needs to be overridden to report the arguments passed in the constructor. The method is before the run() so the description will be saved even if the node running it crashed.
      Returns:
      batch process description or null if there is no additional description

    • getDetailedStatus

      String getDetailedStatus()
      Returns a detailed description of the status, which is useful when integers are not good enough.
      Returns:
      Detailed description

    • getProcessHistory

      ProcessHistory getProcessHistory()
      Returns:
      The ProcessHistory entity associated with this batch process

    • setProcessHistory

      void setProcessHistory(ProcessHistory processHistory)
      Sets the ProcessHistory entity associated with this batch process

    • getIntentionalLogLevel

      default org.slf4j.event.Level getIntentionalLogLevel()
      Allows overriding log level for Intentional logs generated by this batch process. Certain batch processes are auxiliary non business related processes which may run very often, so we do not want to spam the logs with them and want to override the log level.
      Returns:
      log level for the Intentional Logging, default is null meaning that there is no override of default.
